Biosample metadata template for soil samples as defined by the Index of Terms

Biosample metadata template for soil samples as defined by the Index of Terms.

Field Description Guidance Examples Data Status

jgi_gen:default

samp_id:default
Analysis/Data Type Include all the data types associated or available for this biosample, this field can have multiple values separated by a ; This field is constrained to contain only a set of limited terms indicate the types of data that were generated. | pattern generalization: enumeration metagenomics; metabolomics; proteomics None
DNA Absorbance 260/280 260/280 measurement of sample purity Recommended value is between 1 and 3. | pattern generalization: {float} None
DNA Absorbance 260/230 260/230 measurement of sample purity Recommended value is between 1 and 3. | pattern generalization: {float} None
DNA Collection Site Provide information on the site your DNA sample was collected from pattern generalization: {text} untreated pond water None
DNA Concentration Must be calculated using a fluorometric method; value >0 and <2000. Units should be in ng/uL | pattern generalization: {float} ng/uL 100 None
DNA Container Type tube or plate (96-well) pattern generalization: enumeration plate None
DNA Well Number Corner wells must be blank. For partial plates, fill by columns. Leave blank if the sample will be shipped in a tube. Required when 'plate' is selected for container type | pattern generalization: {text} B2 None
DNA Container Label Must be unique across all tubes and plates, and <20 characters. All samples in a plate should have the same plate label. pattern generalization: {text} Pond_MT_041618 None
DNAse Treatment DNA Y/N. Note DNAse treatment is required for all RNA samples. pattern generalization: enumeration No None
DNA Isolation Method Describe the method/protocol/kit used to extract DNA/RNA. pattern generalization: {text} phenol/chloroform extraction None
DNA Expected Organisms List any organisms known or suspected to grow in co-culture, as well as estimated % of the organism in that culture. pattern generalization: {text} expected to contain microbes (59%) fungi (30%), viruses (10%), tadpoles (1%) None
DNA Seq Project Contact Prefilled Do not edit this term, term will be provided by NMDC and can be uploaded | pattern generalization: {text} John Jones None
DNA Sample ID Prefilled Do not edit this term, term will be provided by NMDC and can be uploaded | pattern generalization: {text} 187654 None
DNA Sample Format Choose from the following: Pellet, RNAStable, DNAStable, Ethanol, MDA reaction buffer, PBS, TE, Water, Low EDTA TE, 10 mM Tris-HCl Identify what the DNA sample is suspended in | pattern generalization: enumeration Water None
DNA Sample Name Give the DNA sample a name that is meaningful to you. Sample names must be unique across all JGI projects and contain ASCII characters only. pattern generalization: {text} JGI_pond_041618 None
DNA Seq Project ID Prefilled Do not edit this term, term will be provided by NMDC and can be uploaded | pattern generalization: {text} 1191234 None
DNA Seq Project PI Prefilled Do not edit this term, term will be provided by NMDC and can be uploaded | pattern generalization: {text} Jane Johnson None
DNA Seq Project Name Prefilled Do not edit this term, term will be provided by NMDC and can be uploaded | pattern generalization: {text} JGI Pond metagenomics None
DNA Volume Value must be >0 and <1000 (values <25 by special permission only). Units should be in uL | pattern generalization: {float} uL 25 None
environmental package MIxS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported pattern generalization: enumeration soil None
DNA Proposal ID Prefilled Do not edit this term, term will be provided by NMDC and can be uploaded | pattern generalization: {text} 504000 None
sample linkage A unique identifier to assign parent-child, subsample, or sibling samples. This is relevant when a sample or other material was used to generate the new sample. This field allows multiple entries separated by ; (Examples: Soil collected from the field will link with the soil used in an incubation. The soil a plant was grown in links to the plant sample. An original culture sample was transferred to a new vial and generated a new sample) Multiple identifiers can be provided, separated by a ; | pattern generalization: {text}:{text} IGSN:DSJ0284 None
sample name A local identifier or name that for the material sample collected. Refers to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. Should be human readable | pattern generalization: {text} None
Globally Unique ID A globally unique identifier assigned to the biological sample to link all analytes and subsamples derived from it. Field REQUIRED for ALL sample submission. Options: IGSN- http://www.geosamples.org/getigsn ; UUID- https://www.uuidgenerator.net/ | pattern generalization: {text}:{text} None

MIXS:core field

MIXS:environment field

emsl:default

mixs_modified:default

nmdc:gold_path_field
EMSL Sample Storage Temperature Temperature at which the sample sent to EMSL should be stored pattern generalization: {float} C -80 None
history/agrochemical additions Addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications Expected value: agrochemical name;agrochemical amount;timestamp | Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter | pattern generalization: {text};{float} {unit};{timestamp} roundup;5 milligram per liter;2018-06-21 None
extreme_unusual_properties/Al saturation Aluminum saturation (esp. For tropical soils) Expected value: measurement value | Preferred unit: percentage None
extreme_unusual_properties/Al saturation method Reference or method used in determining Al saturation Expected value: PMID,DOI or URL | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
altitude Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air Expected value: measurement value 100 meter None
mean annual precipitation The average of all annual precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps. Expected value: measurement value | Preferred unit: millimeter None
mean annual temperature Mean annual temperature Expected value: measurement value | Preferred unit: degree Celsius 12.5 degree Celsius None
Collection Date The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point) or interval. Date should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD | pattern generalization: {timestamp} None
Incubation Collection Date Date the incubation was harvested/collected/ended. Only relevant for incubation samples. date and time should be represented as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS GMT | pattern generalization: {timestamp} None
collection time The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point) or interval. Time should be formatted as HH:MM:SS | pattern generalization: HH:MM:SS Time should be reported in GMT (LINK) None
history/crop rotation Whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule Expected value: crop rotation status;schedule | pattern generalization: {boolean};{Rn/start_time/end_time/duration} yes;R2/2017-01-01/2018-12-31/P6M None
current land use Present state of sample site Expected value: enumeration | pattern generalization: [cities|farmstead|industrial areas|roads/railroads|rock|sand|gravel|mudflats|salt flats|badlands|permanent snow or ice|saline seeps|mines/quarries|oil waste areas|small grains|row crops|vegetable crops|horticultural plants (e.g. tulips)|marshlands (grass,sedges,rushes)|tundra (mosses,lichens)|rangeland|pastureland (grasslands used for livestock grazing)|hayland|meadows (grasses,alfalfa,fescue,bromegrass,timothy)|shrub land (e.g. mesquite,sage-brush,creosote bush,shrub oak,eucalyptus)|successional shrub land (tree saplings,hazels,sumacs,chokecherry,shrub dogwoods,blackberries)|shrub crops (blueberries,nursery ornamentals,filberts)|vine crops (grapes)|conifers (e.g. pine,spruce,fir,cypress)|hardwoods (e.g. oak,hickory,elm,aspen)|intermixed hardwood and conifers|tropical (e.g. mangrove,palms)|rainforest (evergreen forest receiving >406 cm annual rainfall)|swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants)|crop trees (nuts,fruit,christmas trees,nursery trees)] conifers None
current vegetation Vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop Expected value: current vegetation type | pattern generalization: {text} None
current vegetation method Reference or method used in vegetation classification Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
depth The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. For sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples. All depths should be reported in meters | pattern generalization: {float}; {float}-{float} 0-0.1 OR 1 None
drainage classification Drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system Expected value: enumeration | pattern generalization: [very poorly|poorly|somewhat poorly|moderately well|well|excessively drained] well None
ecosystem TODO None
ecosystem_category TODO None
ecosystem_subtype TODO None
ecosystem_type TODO None
elevation Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit. Expected value: measurement value 100 meter None
broad-scale environmental context Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS Expected value: The major environment type(s) where the sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes. | pattern generalization: {termLabel} {[termID]} oceanic epipelagic zone biome [ENVO:01000033] for annotating a water sample from the photic zone in middle of the Atlantic Ocean None
local environmental context Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS. Expected value: Environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling. | pattern generalization: {termLabel} {[termID]} litter layer [ENVO:01000338]; Annotating a pooled sample taken from various vegetation layers in a forest consider: canopy [ENVO:00000047]|herb and fern layer [ENVO:01000337]|litter layer [ENVO:01000338]|understory [01000335]|shrub layer [ENVO:01000336]. None
environmental medium Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top). Expected value: The material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483]. | pattern generalization: {termLabel} {[termID]} soil [ENVO:00001998]; Annotating a fish swimming in the upper 100 m of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: ocean water [ENVO:00002151]. Example: Annotating a duck on a pond consider: pond water [ENVO:00002228]|air [ENVO_00002005] None
experimental factor- other Other details about your sample that you feel can't be accurately represented in the available columns. pattern generalization: {text} None
history/extreme events Unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations Expected value: date None
soil_taxonomic/FAO classification Soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources. The list can be found at http://www.fao.org/nr/land/sols/soil/wrb-soil-maps/reference-groups Expected value: enumeration | pattern generalization: [Acrisols|Andosols|Arenosols|Cambisols|Chernozems|Ferralsols|Fluvisols|Gleysols|Greyzems|Gypsisols|Histosols|Kastanozems|Lithosols|Luvisols|Nitosols|Phaeozems|Planosols|Podzols|Podzoluvisols|Rankers|Regosols|Rendzinas|Solonchaks|Solonetz|Vertisols|Yermosols] Luvisols None
Filter Method Type of filter used or how the sample was filteres pattern generalization: {text} None
history/fire Historical and/or physical evidence of fire Expected value: date None
history/flooding Historical and/or physical evidence of flooding Expected value: date None
geographic location (country and/or sea,region) The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ) Expected value: country or sea name (INSDC or GAZ): region(GAZ), specific location name | pattern generalization: {term}: {term}, {text} USA: Maryland, Bethesda None
growth facility Type of facility/location where the sample was harvested; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. pattern generalization: enumeration None
extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals Heavy metals present in the sequenced sample and their concentrations. For multiple heavy metals and concentrations, add multiple copies of this field. Expected value: heavy metal name;measurement value unit | Preferred unit: microgram per gram | pattern generalization: {text};{float} {unit} mercury;0.09 micrograms per gram None
extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals method Reference or method used in determining heavy metals Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
horizon method Reference or method used in determining the horizon Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
isotope exposure/addition List isotope exposure or addition applied to your sample. pattern generalization: {termLabel} {[termID]}; {timestamp} None
geographic location (latitude and longitude) The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system Expected value: decimal degrees, limit to 8 decimal points | pattern generalization: {float} {float} 50.586825 6.408977 None
link to classification information Link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
link to climate information Link to climate resource Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
soil_taxonomic/local classification Soil classification based on local soil classification system Expected value: local classification name | pattern generalization: {text} None
soil_taxonomic/local classification method Reference or method used in determining the local soil classification Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
microbial biomass carbon method Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass required if "microbial_biomass_C" is provided | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
microbial biomass nitrogen method Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass nitrogen required if "microbial_biomass_N" is provided | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
microbial biomass method Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
microbial biomass The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units Expected value: measurement value | Preferred unit: ton, kilogram, gram per kilogram soil None
microbial biomass carbon The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units pattern generalization: {float} {unit} None
microbial biomass nitrogen The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units pattern generalization: {float} {unit} None
miscellaneous parameter Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here Expected value: parameter name;measurement value | pattern generalization: {text};{float} {unit} Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None
non-microbial biomass Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g.insect, plant, total. Can include multiple measurements separated by ; pattern generalization: {text};{float} {unit} None
non-microbial biomass method Reference or method used in determining biomass required if "non-microbial biomass" is provided | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
organic nitrogen method Method used for obtaining organic nitrogen pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} required if "org_nitro_ is provided None
other treatments Other treatments applied to your samples that are not applicable to the provided fields pattern generalization: {text} None
relationship to oxygen Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments pattern generalization: enumeration None
pH Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid Expected value: measurement value | pattern generalization: {float} 7.2 None

profile position Cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas Expected value: enumeration | pattern generalization: [summit|shoulder|backslope|footslope|toeslope] summit None
Project ID Proposal IDs or names associated with dataset pattern generalization: {text} None
Replicate Number If sending biological replicates, indicate the rep number here. This will guide staff in ensuring your samples are block & randomized correctly | pattern generalization: {integer} None
salinity method Reference or method used in determining salinity Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
observed biotic relationship Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with. E.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y. The target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object pattern generalization: enumeration None
amount or size of sample collected The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected. This referes to the TOTAL amount of sample collected from the experiment. NOT the amount sent to each institution or collected for a specific analysis. | pattern generalization: {float} {unit} 5 grams; 10 mL None
sample collection device The device used to collect an environmental sample. This field accepts terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). This field also accepts terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094). Report dimensions and details when applicable | pattern generalization: {termLabel} {[termID]}|{text} None
sample collection method The method employed for collecting the sample. This can be a citation or description | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL}|{text} None
sample material processing A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed. pattern generalization: {text} None
sample shipped amount The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample sent to EMSL pattern generalization: {float} {unit} None
sample type Type of sample being submitted This can vary from 'environmental package' if the sample is an extraction. | pattern generalization: enumeration water extracted soil None
mean seasonal precipitation The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps. Expected value: measurement value | Preferred unit: millimeter None
mean seasonal temperature Mean seasonal temperature Expected value: measurement value | Preferred unit: degree Celsius 18 degree Celsius None
composite design/sieving Collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved Expected value: design name and/or size;amount | pattern generalization: {{text}|{float} {unit}};{float} {unit} None
slope aspect The direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., nw or 315 degrees. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration. Expected value: measurement value | Preferred unit: degree None
slope gradient Commonly called 'slope'. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer Expected value: measurement value | Preferred unit: percentage None
soil horizon Specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath Expected value: enumeration | pattern generalization: [O horizon|A horizon|E horizon|B horizon|C horizon|R layer|Permafrost] A horizon None
soil texture measurement The relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional. Expected value: measurement value None
soil texture method Reference or method used in determining soil texture Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
soil type Description of the soil type or classification. This field accepts terms under soil (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001998). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes. Expected value: ENVO_00001998 | pattern generalization: {termLabel} {[termID]} plinthosol [ENVO:00002250] None
soil type method Reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification Expected value: PMID,DOI or url | pattern generalization: {PMID}|{DOI}|{URL} None
